name: Pilot
summary: Sheldon learns that his high intelligence isn't always helpful growing up in East Texas, where church and football are king.

name: Rockets, Communists, and the Dewey Decimal System
summary: To appease his worried mother, Sheldon employs the techniques of a self-help book to try and make a friend

name: Poker, Faith, and Eggs
summary: When George Sr. is rushed to the emergency room, Meemaw comes to babysit, and the kids have an adventure getting to the hospital on their own.

name: A Therapist, a Comic Book, and a Breakfast Sausage
summary: After choking on a breakfast sausage, Sheldon wrestles with his fear of solid foods and discovers comic books for the first time.

name: A Solar Calculator, a Game Ball, and a Cheerleader's Bosom
summary: Sheldon struggles with newfound popularity after utilizing statistics to help the football team.

name: A Patch, a Modem, and a Zantac®
summary: When a NASA representative visits Sheldon's school and dismisses his science, Sheldon is set on a mission to prove him wrong.

name: A Brisket, Voodoo, and Cannonball Run
summary: The kids brainstorm ways to resolve a family feud when Meemaw refuses to give George Sr. her brisket recipe.

name: Cape Canaveral, Schrödinger's Cat, and Cyndi Lauper's Hair
summary: In an attempt to bond with Sheldon, George Sr. takes the boys on a road trip to see a space shuttle launch. Also, Mary, Missy and Meemaw have a girls' weekend at the salon.

name: Spock, Kirk, and Testicular Hernia
summary: George Sr. strikes a deal with Sheldon to tutor Georgie when poor grades threaten to keep him from playing football.

name: An Eagle Feather, a String Bean, and an Eskimo
summary: When Sheldon moves to Dallas to attend a school for gifted children, the family struggles to cope with his absence.

name: Demons, Sunday School, and Prime Numbers
summary: A worried Mary sends Sheldon to Sunday school after she finds him playing Dungeons and Dragons with his friends Tam and Billy.

name: A Computer, a Plastic Pony, and a Case of Beer
summary: Sheldon asks for a computer and unknowingly sparks a heated argument between Mary and George Sr. over the family's finances.

name: A Sneeze, Detention and Sissy Spacek
summary: When flu season hits Medford, Sheldon takes extreme measures to remain healthy.

name: Potato Salad, a Broomstick, and Dad's Whiskey
summary: When Mary takes a job as church secretary, she finds herself becoming Pastor Jeff's marriage counselor. Also, Sheldon and Missy spend their first afternoon home alone.

name: Dolomite, Apple Slices, and a Mystery Woman
summary: Sheldon makes friends with an upperclassman who introduces him to a new field of science. Also, Mary and George disagree on how to handle Sheldon's blossoming social life.

name: Killer Asteroids, Oklahoma, and a Frizzy Hair Machine
summary: A disappointing loss at the science fair sends Sheldon's life in a new direction.

name: Jiu-Jitsu, Bubble Wrap, and Yoo-hoo
summary: Sheldon is bullied by an unlikely character, and Mary and George disagree on how to handle the situation.

name: A Mother, a Child and a Blue Man's Backside
summary: Mary bans Sheldon from reading a mature comic book, and Sheldon decides it's time to stop living under Mary's thumb.

name: Gluons, Guacamole, and the Color Purple
summary: When Sheldon is no longer academically challenged at Medford High, he audits a college class taught by Dr. John Sturgis.

name: A Dog, a Squirrel, and a Fish Named Fish
summary: A battle erupts between the Coopers and Sparks when the Sparks' new dog terrorizes Sheldon.

name: Summer Sausage, a Pocket Poncho, and Tony Danza
summary: While Sheldon is busy keeping tabs on Meemaw's budding relationship with Dr. Sturgis, George Sr. and Mary attempt to bond with their other children.

name: Vanilla Ice Cream, Gentleman Callers, and a Dinette Set
summary: When Meemaw is pursued by two gentlemen callers, Sheldon interferes, forcing her to set some ground rules.

name: A High-Pitched Buzz and Training Wheels
summary: After Sheldon dismantles the refrigerator to stop an annoying hum, he gets a paper route to pay for the repairs.

name: A Rival Prodigy and Sir Isaac Neutron
summary: When Dr. Sturgis bonds with Paige, another 10-year-old genius, Sheldon's jealousy leads Meemaw to intervene. Also, Mary invites Paige's family over for a play date.

name: A Crisis of Faith and Octopus Aliens
summary: When Mary's faith is shaken by a tragedy in the community, Sheldon becomes an unlikely ally.

name: A Financial Secret and Fish Sauce
summary: When George Sr. asks Sheldon to keep a secret from Mary, the stress of not being honest drives Sheldon to hideout at Tam's for his first sleepover.

name: A Research Study and Czechoslovakian Wedding Pastries
summary: Dr. Sturgis recommends Sheldon and Missy for a university research study on twins, and Mary is unhappy when the test results go to Sheldon's head.

name: Seven Deadly Sins and a Small Carl Sagan
summary: Mary clashes with Sheldon's drama teacher over plans for a Halloween fundraiser for the church. Also, Georgie falls for a rebellious teenage girl that Sheldon is tutoring.

name: Carbon Dating and a Stuffed Raccoon
summary: Sheldon gets into trouble with fellow child genius Paige at the science museum. Also, George Sr. is forced to play therapist to Paige's bickering parents, and Mary, Georgie and Missy help Meemaw with a garage sale.

name: An 8-Bit Princess and a Flat Tire Genius
summary: A video game takes over Sheldon and Meemaw's life. Also, George Sr. is jealous when Georgie bonds with Herschel at the auto shop.

name: Family Dynamics and a Red Fiero
summary: Sheldon studies his family for a psychology project, and Thanksgiving dinner turns into a family fight when George Sr. is offered a job in Oklahoma

name: A Stunted Childhood and a Can of Fancy Mixed Nuts
summary: When Sheldon learns that people with stunted childhoods can turn into social outcasts, he tries to act like a kid. Also, Meemaw and Dr. Sturgis' relationship is tested when she teaches him how to drive.

name: A Race of Superhumans and a Letter to Alf
summary: Sheldon experiments on Missy, and Georgie joins Mary's bible study to spend more time with his crush, Veronica.

name: A Tummy Ache and a Whale of a Metaphor
summary: When Sheldon has to spend a few days in the hospital, he turns into the world's worst patient. Also, Missy gets a taste of what life would be like without her twin.

name: A Nuclear Reactor and a Boy Called Lovey
summary: Sheldon attempts to build a nuclear reactor. Also, a university cocktail party gets heated when Dr. Sturgis' colleague, Dr. Linkletter, flirts with Meemaw, and Georgie is heartbroken when he learns Veronica has a boyfriend.

name: David, Goliath, and a Yoo-hoo from the Back
summary: Sheldon uses his new friendship with the school bully to boss Georgie around. Also, Missy steals Meemaw's makeup for picture day.

name: A Math Emergency and Perky Palms
summary: Sheldon and Dr. Sturgis have their first fight when Dr. Sturgis marks a question wrong on Sheldon's test. Also, Mary takes over for Pastor Jeff when he's out sick.

name: A Loaf of Bread and a Grand Old Flag
summary: Things spiral out of control when Sheldon boycotts his favorite bread company. Also, Georgie offers Veronica a shoulder to cry on when she's dumped by her boyfriend.

name: Albert Einstein and the Story of Another Mary
summary: Inspired by his hero, Albert Einstein, Sheldon tries his hand at the violin. Also, Mary and Meemaw secretly buy a pregnancy test when Mary thinks she's pregnant

name: A Perfect Score and a Bunsen Burner Marshmallow
summary: Sheldon moves in with Dr. Sturgis for the weekend to see what his life will be like in college. Also, a lonely Mary tries to bond with the other Coopers during Sheldon's absence.

name: A Political Campaign and a Candy Land Cheater
summary: Unhappy that school funds are going towards football rather than academics, Sheldon decides to run for class president.

name: A Proposal and a Popsicle Stick Cross
summary: Georgie is thrilled when Veronica stays at the Coopers' house for a few days. Also, Meemaw and Dr. Sturgis celebrate their one-year anniversary.

name: A Broken Heart and a Crock Monster
summary: The Coopers help Pastor Jeff (Matt Hobby) through a rough patch in his marriage. Also, Sheldon pressures church members for donations when Mary takes him to work for a day.

name: A Swedish Science Thing and the Equation for Toast
summary: Sheldon invites the entire school to a party for the Nobel Prize announcements. Also, Meemaw learns more about Dr. Sturgis' past, and Georgie's desire for cable TV leads to a standoff between him and George Sr.

name: Quirky Eggheads and Texas Snow Globes
summary: After Dr. Sturgis experiences a nervous breakdown, Mary worries Sheldon is headed down a similar path; Georgie discovers he has a knack for sales.

name: A Broom Closet and Satan's Monopoly Board
summary: Without Dr. Sturgis' university class, Sheldon must find a new way to stay academically challenged. Also, Mary helps Pastor Jeff avoid temptation with his girlfriend.

name: An Entrepreneurialist and a Swat on the Bottom
summary: Sheldon takes matters into his own hands when Meemaw refuses to drive him to a lecture with Dr. Linkletter (Ed Begley, Jr.). Also, Georgie tries to impress Veronica with his new business venture.

name: Hobbitses, Physicses and a Ball with Zip
summary: Sheldon is forced to take a break from science when his new obsession with "The Lord of the Rings" leads to an unhealthy habit. Also, Missy asks George Sr. to teach her how to play catch.

name: A Pineapple and the Bosom of Male Friendship
summary: After being released from the mental hospital, Dr. Sturgis unexpectedly breaks up with Meemaw.

name: A Parasol and a Hell of an Arm
summary: A church carnival leads Missy to try out for the baseball team. Also, Meemaw struggles after her breakup with Dr. Sturgis.

name: Pongo Pygmaeus and a Culture that Encourages Spitting
summary: Sheldon starts an internet flame war, and Missy stands up to the boys on her baseball team. Also, Meemaw is unhappy when George Sr. spends time with her new boyfriend.

name: The Sin of Greed and a Chimichanga from Chi-chi's
summary: The University makes George Sr. a lucrative job offer in the hopes of recruiting Sheldon. Also, Georgie gets a job working for Meemaw's new boyfriend, and Mary is determined to rid her home of greed.

name: A Party Invitation, Football Grapes and an Earth Chicken
summary: Mary gets Pastor Jeff involved when Sheldon isn't invited to Billy's birthday party. Also, George Sr. has "male-bonding time" with Dr. Sturgis.

name: Teenager Soup and a Little Ball of Fib
summary: Sheldon fakes being sick to avoid a swim test at school. Also, Dr. Sturgis spies on Meemaw's new boyfriend.

name: A Live Chicken, a Fried Chicken and Holy Matrimony
summary: George Sr. and Meemaw struggle to manage the Cooper household while Mary plans Pastor Jeff's wedding.

name: Body Glitter and a Mall Safety Kit
summary: Sheldon learns to listen when an emotional Paige struggles with her parents' divorce. Also, George Sr. is furious when Georgie tries to buy his way out of chores.

name: Contracts, Rules and a Little Bit of Pig Brains
summary: George Sr. and Georgie go camping with Meemaw's new boyfriend, Dale, but things get complicated when her ex-boyfriend, Dr. Sturgis, tags along. Also, Sheldon and Missy invent a super-game.

name: A Slump, a Cross and Roadside Gravel
summary: Sheldon and Georgie mine for platinum in roadside gravel. Also, Mary is concerned when Missy misuses religion to help with a batting slump.

name: A Boyfriend's Ex-Wife and a Good Luck Head Rub
summary: Meemaw meets Dale's ex-wife, June. Also, Sheldon is forced to work on a group project with reluctant college students.

name: Pasadena
summary: Sheldon visits CalTech for the very first time. Also, Georgie is furious when Mary listens in on a phone call with his girlfriend, and Meemaw tries to cheer up a jealous Missy.

name: An Academic Crime and a More Romantic Taco Bell
summary: Dr. Sturgis is furious when Sheldon accuses him of plagiarism. Also, Mary sets out to find a "girl trophy" for Missy's end-of-season baseball ceremony, and Georgie has an awkward run-in with Veronica while on a date with his new girlfriend, Jana.

name: A Couple Bruised Ribs and a Cereal Box Ghost Detector
summary: When George Sr. accidentally lands the school librarian, Ms. Hutchins, in the hospital, the Cooper family must nurse her back to health. Also, Meemaw gives Georgie relationship advice.

name: A House for Sale and Serious Woman Stuff
summary: When Sheldon learns the house next door is for sale, he takes it upon himself to find the perfect neighbors. Also, Missy is torn when she's forced to pitch against her boyfriend at the baseball game.

name: A Baby Tooth and the Egyptian God of Knowledge
summary: Sheldon has a scientific breakthrough at the dentist's office. Also, Dale and Meemaw go to the casino, and Georgie makes a big mistake when Dale leaves him in charge of the store.

name: A Secret Letter and a Lowly Disc of Processed Meat
summary: Sheldon discovers that Mary's been keeping a secret about his future. Also, Meemaw is furious when she learns Dale fired Georgie.

name: Graduation
summary: After graduating high school, Sheldon has a breakdown when he realizes he may not be ready for college. Also, Dale tries to make amends with Meemaw.

name: A Docent, a Little Lady and a Bouncer Named Dalton
summary: Sheldon gets a summer job at the local train museum. Also, George and Missy bond when Missy embarks on a new stage of womanhood, and Georgie discovers Mary's guilty pleasure.

name: Training Wheels and an Unleashed Chicken
summary: With college in sight, Sheldon is determined to ride his bike without training wheels. Also, Mary and George Sr. argue over parenting styles.

name: Bible Camp and a Chariot of Love
summary: Sheldon finds himself in a fierce competition with Paige when their mothers force them to attend Vacation Bible School; George is furious after Georgie makes a questionable purchase.

name: A Musty Crypt and a Stick to Pee On
summary: Dale and Meemaw work out relationship issues while playing Dungeons and Dragons with Sheldon and Missy. Also, Mary and George take a trip with Coach Wilkins and his wife, and Georgie freaks out when his girlfriend thinks she's pregnant.

name: Freshman Orientation and the Inventor of the Zipper
summary: College orientation does not go as Sheldon planned. Also, Mary is invited to a party when she's mistaken for a university student, and George Sr. helps Pastor Jeff set up a children's nursery.

name: A Philosophy Class and Worms That Can Chase You
summary: Sheldon's first day of college is derailed by his new philosophy teacher, Professor Ericson. Also, Mary and Brenda live vicariously through Missy's first day of middle school.

name: An Existential Crisis and a Bear That Makes Bubbles
summary: Meemaw takes matters into her own hands when Sheldon's philosophy teacher, Professor Ericson, sends him into a tailspin. Also, George Sr. learns Georgie has been cutting class.

name: Crappy Frozen Ice Cream and an Organ Grinder's Monkey
summary: Sheldon and George Sr. dine with President Hagemeyer and a university benefactor. Also, Georgie gives Missy some brotherly advice when Mary won't let her go to the school dance, and Dale and June convince Meemaw to attend their son's wedding.

name: Cowboy Aerobics and 473 Grease-Free Bolts
summary: Sheldon campaigns to become Dr. Linkletter's lab assistant. Also, Georgie enlists the help of Mr. Lundy, the drama teacher, for a surprising business venture.

name: A Pager, a Club and a Cranky Bag of Wrinkles
summary: Dr. Linkletter pushes Sheldon to make friends with his fellow students at college. Also, Georgie gets a pager.

name: A Box of Treasure and the Meemaw of Science
summary: Sheldon, Dr. Linkletter and Meemaw team up on a science experiment. Also, Mary is jealous that Pastor Jeff and Brenda are spending time together, and Georgie has a new side hustle.

name: The Geezer Bus and a New Model for Education
summary: Sheldon refuses to ride in a car after getting into an accident with Meemaw. Also, Missy uses their trauma to her advantage at school and Meemaw is forced to take the church shuttle while her car is in the shop.

name: Mitch's Son and the Unconditional Approval of a Government Agency
summary: When the IRS accuses Sheldon of making a mistake, he'll stop at nothing to prove them wrong. Also, Dale is forced to get a colonoscopy and tries to convince Meemaw to join him.

name: A Virus, Heartbreak and a World of Possibilities
summary: Sheldon is caught in a moral dilemma when offered a bootleg copy of a computer game he can't afford. Also, Mary and Meemaw take Brenda out for girls' night while George Sr. and the guys watch Billy, and Missy asks Georgie to take her and Marcus on a secret date.

name: A Second Prodigy and the Hottest Tips for Pouty Lips
summary: Sheldon finds himself at odds with Paige once again when she considers enrolling at East Texas Tech. Also, Mary seeks June's advice when looking for a change.

name: A Black Hole
summary: The Coopers discuss the possibilities of black holes and alternate universes when Dr. Sturgis comes over for dinner,

name: The Wild and Woolly World of Nonlinear Dynamics
summary: Missy's first heartbreak triggers a series of events that lead the Cooper family to the brink.

name: One Bad Night and Chaos of Selfish Desires
summary: Sheldon and Missy both run away from home, and Mary gets upsetting news about George Sr.

name: Snoopin' Around and the Wonder Twins of Atheism
summary: Sheldon encourages Missy to question the Bible. Also, Meemaw is determined to catch George Sr. in a lie, and Mary helps Pastor Jeff search for a youth pastor.

name: Potential Energy and Hooch on a Park Bench
summary: Sheldon tries to convince Dr. Sturgis to return to the university. Also, Georgie upsets the family when he makes a life-changing decision.

name: Pish Posh and a Secret Back Room
summary: Sheldon, Missy and Georgie adapt to new living arrangements. Also, Meemaw opens a gambling room.

name: Stuffed Animals and A Sweet Southern Syzygy
summary: Sheldon and Dr. Linkletter struggle to solve an equation. Also, Georgie has a solution for Meemaw's business woes, and George Sr. gives advice on Missy's love life.

name: Money Laundering and a Cascade of Hormones
summary: Missy asks some uncomfortable questions at church, and Meemaw and Georgie go into business together.

name: An Introduction to Engineering and a Glob of Hair Gel
summary: Sheldon takes his first engineering class with Professor Boucher. Also, Meemaw and Dale help take care of his ex-wife, June.

name: The Grand Chancellor and a Den of Sin
summary: Sheldon battles President Hagemeyer's mysterious boss over the university's science requirements. Also, Mary discovers that Georgie is working at Meemaw's illegal gambling room.

name: The Yips and an Oddly Hypnotic Bohemian
summary: Sheldon gets the science yips and has to learn how to not think. Also, George Sr. plays handyman at Brenda Sparks' house.

name: An Expensive Glitch and a Goof-Off Room
summary: Sheldon gets a dorm room all to himself. Also, Meemaw gains an unwanted business partner.

name: A Lock-In, a Weather Girl and a Disgusting Habit
summary: Sheldon acts as Mary's spy during a youth lock-in at church. Also, Georgie is attracted to an older woman, Mandy.

name: A Pink Cadillac and a Glorious Tribal Dance
summary: Sheldon attends his first comic book convention. Also, Mary tries selling make-up.

name: A Lot of Band-Aids and the Cooper Surrender
summary: Sheldon makes friends with his dorm neighbors. Also, George Sr. learns his job is in jeopardy.

name: A Free Scratcher and Feminine Wiles
summary: Sheldon butts heads with Dr. Lee, a new scientist in the lab. Also, Mary is given a lotto ticket.

name: A Lobster, an Armadillo and a Way Bigger Number
summary: Sheldon joins Dr. Linkletter and Dr. Sturgis on a science road trip. Also, Georgie continues to lie about his age.

name: A Suitcase Full of Cash and a Yellow Clown Car
summary: Meemaw's gambling room is a success, and Sheldon dips his toe in the stock market. Also, Missy starts a business.

name: A Solo Peanut, a Social Butterfly and the Truth
summary: Sheldon gets an odd request from an old friend, Paige. Also, George Sr. and Mary are caught in the middle of Meemaw and Dale's breakup, and Georgie comes clean to Mandy.

name: Babies, Lies and a Resplendent Cannoli
summary: Sheldon copes with the death of a hero. Also, Missy wants to babysit, and Georgie struggles with his big secret.

name: A God-Fearin' Baptist and a Hot Trophy Husband
summary: George and Mary insist on meeting the new woman in Georgie's life. Also, Sheldon and Missy have suspicions about what's going on with their family.

name: Uncle Sheldon and a Hormonal Firecracker
summary: Sheldon and Missy learn about Georgie's pregnancy, and the whole family promises to keep it a secret.

name: White Trash, Holy Rollers and Punching People
summary: As the church congregation gossips about Georgie, Missy stands up for her brother, and Sheldon is distracted by the family drama.

name: A Clogged Pore, a Little Spanish and the Future
summary: Sheldon struggles to cope with the first signs of puberty, Mary and George Sr. both hunt for new jobs, and Georgie and Meemaw take a business trip across the border.

name: Four Hundred Cartons of Undeclared Cigarettes and a Niblingo
summary: George Sr. bails Meemaw and Georgie out of jail. Also, Sheldon and Missy meet Mandy, and Mary feels unwelcome at church.

name: Future Worf and the Margarita of the South Pacific
summary: Sheldon and Missy try to help the family's finances. Also, Mary struggles to find her footing without the church.

name: Passion's Harvest and a Sheldocracy
summary: Sheldon must choose sides in an ethical dilemma. Also, Mary tries her hand at writing and Mandy needs a new place to live.

name: Blonde Ambition and the Concept of Zero
summary: Sheldon makes a terrifying mathematical discovery while tutoring Billy. Also, Mary is jealous of Missy's relationship with Mandy and Meemaw.

name: A Resident Advisor and the Word 'Sketchy'
summary: At college, Sheldon decides to expand his responsibilities and become a dorm resident advisor. Also, Meemaw and Dale make a sketchy business deal and Mary and George Sr. rekindle their romance.

name: An Ugly Car, an Affair and Some Kickass Football
summary: George Sr. is asked to help with the football team. Also, Mandy discovers Georgie and Meemaw's secret business.

name: A Tougher Nut and a Note on File
summary: Sheldon's search for a comic book leads him to a breakthrough. Also, Georgie and Mandy have an uncomfortable first encounter with her parents, Jim and Audrey.

name: Legalese and a Whole Hoo-Ha
summary: Sheldon's database invention puts him at odds with the university. Also, the church takes issue with Meemaw's video store.

name: College Dropouts and the Medford Miracle
summary: Sheldon considers dropping out of college to focus on building his database. Also, George Sr. is frustrated when someone else gets credit for his football wins.

name: Pancake Sunday and Textbook Flirting
summary: Mary struggles to make new friends while Mandy pushes Georgie to date another woman.

name: Ruthless, Toothless and a Week of Bed Rest
summary: Sheldon learns the university is building a database without him. Also, Mary takes care of a bedridden Mandy and Meemaw.

name: A Baby Shower and Testosterone-Rich Banter
summary: Mary butts heads with Mandy's mother, Audrey, and Sheldon attempts male bonding.

name: A Frat Party, a Sleepover and the Mother of All Blisters
summary: Paige drags Sheldon to a college party and Missy gets caught in a lie.

name: A Launch Party and a Whole Human Being
summary: The Coopers can't be found as Mandy goes into labor. Also, Sheldon is excited about the launch of his database.

name: Teen Angst and a Smart-Boy Walk of Shame
summary: Sheldon confronts the failure of his database. Also, Georgie and Mandy struggle as new parents and Missy feels forgotten.

name: A Stolen Truck and Going on the Lam
summary: Missy steals her dad's truck and hits the road with her friend Paige.

name: A German Folk Song and an Actual Adult
summary: Georgie goes on a birthday date and Mary confronts Brenda about her relationship with George. Also, Sheldon takes an interest in Missy's favorite TV show.

name: Little Green Men and a Fella's Marriage Proposal
summary: Sheldon wants to search for life on other planets and Mandy answers Georgie's marriage proposal. Also, Missy is caught between two friends.

name: A New Weather Girl and a Stay-at-Home Coddler
summary: Mandy gets an exciting job opportunity and Sheldon worries that he's falling behind. Also, Georgie takes his daughter to work.

name: German for Beginners and a Crazy Old Man with a Bat
summary: The gambling room gets broken into and Sheldon wants to study abroad. Also, Missy makes a new friend.

name: A Romantic Getaway and a Germanic Meat-Based Diet
summary: Mandy surprises Georgie with a spa weekend and Sheldon prepares for his summer in Germany.

name: A Tornado, a 10-Hour Flight and a Darn Fine Ring
summary: Sheldon and Mary head to Germany while the rest of the Cooper family braves a tornado that is heading straight for Medford.

name: Half a Wiener Schnitzel and Underwear in a Tree
summary: News of the tornado reaches Sheldon and Mary in Germany. Also, with the Cooper house in chaos, Missy steps up.

name: A Roulette Wheel and a Piano Playing Dog
summary: Sheldon realizes he is the weakest student in his class; Meemaw is looking to expand her gambling business.

name: A Strudel and a Hot American Boy Toy
summary: Sheldon explores Germany behind Mary's back, Missy attempts to pull a fast one on George Sr. and Meemaw and Dale adjust to living together.
